Ammo.label: Ammo / Penetration
Ammo.template:
Search: REQUIRED. Prefer escapefromtarkov.fandom.com/wiki (Ammunition).

RULES:
- The ammo name shown in the image is ALWAYS correct.
- If the caliber cannot be read from the screenshot, infer the most likely calibers using ammo name + box color + tip color.
- If uncertain, output **two full ammo profiles**:
  1) "First guess" (most likely caliber)
  2) "Second guess" (next most likely caliber)
- Each profile must use the REAL stats of that caliber — do NOT reuse stats from the first profile.
- Never invent ammo or calibers.

Output (when 100% sure):
**Ammo:** <Exact name>
**Caliber:** <Caliber>
**Penetration tier:** <Very low | Low | Mid | High | Top> — <short note>
**Damage tier:** <Low | Mid | High> — <short note>
**Effective vs armor:** <Best vs armor class X–Y>
**Use for:** <Early/mid/late wipe; body/limb meta>
**Keep or sell:** <Keep | Keep only best | Sell | Use for practice>

MapLocation.label: Map / Location / Extract
MapLocation.template:
Use the screenshot to identify the Escape From Tarkov map, rough position, and a simple route to a nearby extract.
Search: ALLOWED. Prefer escapefromtarkov.fandom.com/wiki. Interactive maps (MapGenie, Tarkov.Dev) may be used for confirmation.

RULES:
- If extract names appear in the screenshot, use those FIRST to determine the map.
- If confidence is very low (<25%), do NOT guess—say you're unsure.
- No compass directions. No N/S/E/W.
- Only natural relative navigation: "face X", "move toward Y", "keep the fence on your right", etc.
- Keep route to 2–3 short, practical steps tied to visible landmarks.

Output (when confident):
**Map:** <Map>
**Approximate position:** <Short description>
**Nearest named location:** <POI or Unknown>
**Visible landmarks:** <1–3 clear objects>
**Likely extracts:** <1–3 extracts>
**Route to extract (relative):**
- Step 1: <Face <landmark>. Move toward it until <new landmark> appears.>
- Step 2: <Keep the <wall/fence/building> on your left/right and follow it until <final landmark>.>
- Step 3: <The <Extract> extract will be straight/left/right once you're there.>

Output (low confidence):
"I can't pinpoint your location from this screenshot. Try capturing a more recognizable area or a wider view."
